isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 10 SPEED AND 15 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT, RTO, AND RTX SERIES - INSTALL - RIGHT COUNTERSHAFT ASSEMBLY

note.para: The left countershaft assembly MUST remain in time with main drive gear when timing right countershaft assembly.

step1.para: Remove the blocking from the right countershaft assembly and place it parallel to the mainshaft assembly. Mesh the marked tooth of the right countershaft drive gear with the remaining set of two marked teeth on the main drive gear ( Figure 231).

figure.caption: Figure 231. Mesh Marked Tooth of Right Countershaft Drive Gear With Remaining Set of Two Marked Teeth

step1.para: Insert the countershaft support tool or blocking in the rear bearing bore ( Figure 232).

figure.caption: Figure 232. Insert Countershaft Support Tool or Blocking in Rear Bearing Bore

step1.para: Position the front countershaft bearing in the front bearing bore ( Figure 233). Use the proper bearing driver to seat the bearing.

figure.caption: Figure 233. Position Front Countershaft Bearing in Front Bearing Bore

step1.para: Install the retainer washer and bolt ( Figure 234). Make sure to match roll pin in the retainer with the inner bearing hole. Tighten the bolt to 90 to 120 ft-lbs. (122 to 163 N·m).

figure.caption: Figure 234. Install Retainer Washer and Bolt

step1.para: Position the countershaft rear bearing in the rear bearing bore ( Figure 235). Use a suitable bearing driver to seat bearing in the bore.

figure.caption: Figure 235. Position Countershaft Rear Bearing in Rear Bearing Bore

step1.para: With bearing installation complete, install the snap ring in the right countershaft rear groove ( Figure 236).

figure.caption: Figure 236. Install Snap Ring in Right Countershaft Rear Groove

step1.para: Move the reverse gear to the rear on the mainshaft and use a screwdriver to engage sliding clutches with all forward speed gears ( Figure 237). A sliding clutch that will not engage with a gear indicates the gear set is not in proper mesh. The bearings of the right countershaft would then need to be removed and the drive gear set retimed.

figure.caption: Figure 237. Engage Sliding Clutches With All Forward Speed Gears

note.para: Do not engage sliding clutches with more than one gear at the same time. This will lock the gearing and prevent the mainshaft and countershaft assemblies from rotating.
